common_errors.cause: Operation requires elevated privileges or policy permission
common_errors.solution: Use sudo for privileged operations. Or configure PolicyKit for user access.

common_errors.cause: Session ID doesn't exist or has ended
common_errors.solution: List active sessions: loginctl list-sessions. Use valid session ID.

common_errors.cause: User doesn't have active session or doesn't exist
common_errors.solution: List users with sessions: loginctl list-users. Check user exists: id username
Start service: sudo systemctl start systemd-logind

common_errors.cause: Cannot terminate session (own session or protected session)
common_errors.solution: Cannot terminate your own session. Use kill for processes instead.

common_errors.error_pattern: Failed to kill session.*No such process
common_errors.solution: Session may have ended. Refresh session list.

common_errors.cause: Session doesn't support locking or no lock handler
common_errors.solution: Lock requires screen locker configured. Set up systemd-logind inhibitors.

common_errors.cause: PolicyKit denies the action for current user

common_errors.solution: List seats: loginctl list-seats. Default is seat0.
Check commands: loginctl --help. Common: list-sessions, show-session, terminate-session
